trans-unit.source: Adds a transparency to the specified 32 bits-per-pixel icon

seg-source.mrk: Adds a transparency to the specified 32 bits-per-pixel icon

target.mrk: Adds a transparency to the specified 32 bits-per-pixel icon

seg-source.mrk: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the icon.

target.mrk: Handle to the icon.

trans-unit.source: [optional] A value (in percent) that specifies how much to decrease the values of the alpha channel for the specified icon. If this parameter is 0, the function returns a fully transparent icon. Default is 80.

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
A value (in percent) that specifies how much to decrease the values of the alpha channel for the specified icon.
If this parameter is 0, the function returns a fully transparent icon.
Default is 80.

target.mrk: [optional]
A value (in percent) that specifies how much to decrease the values of the alpha channel for the specified icon.
If this parameter is 0, the function returns a fully transparent icon.
Default is 80.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Specifies whether to delete the icon after the function is successful, valid values:

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
Specifies whether to delete the icon after the function is successful, valid values:

target.mrk: [optional]
Specifies whether to delete the icon after the function is successful, valid values:

trans-unit.source: True - Icon will be deleted if the function succeeds.

seg-source.mrk: True - Icon will be deleted if the function succeeds.

target.mrk: True - Icon will be deleted if the function succeeds.

trans-unit.source: False - Do not delete, you must release the icon when you are finished using it (Default).

seg-source.mrk: False - Do not delete, you must release the icon when you are finished using it (Default).

target.mrk: False - Do not delete, you must release the icon when you are finished using it (Default).

seg-source.mrk: Return Value

target.mrk: Return Value

trans-unit.source: Handle to the newly created icon.

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the newly created icon.

target.mrk: Handle to the newly created icon.

trans-unit.source: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

seg-source.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

target.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

seg-source.mrk: Remarks

target.mrk: Remarks

trans-unit.source: This function only works with 32 bits-per-pixel with alpha chanel (RGB + Alpha) icons.

seg-source.mrk: This function only works with 32 bits-per-pixel with alpha chanel (RGB + Alpha) icons.

target.mrk: This function only works with 32 bits-per-pixel with alpha chanel (RGB + Alpha) icons.

trans-unit.source: If the source icon has no alpha chanel, the resulting icon will be the same as the source icon. If the source icon is non 32 bits-per-pixel, the function fails.

seg-source.mrk: If the source icon has no alpha chanel, the resulting icon will be the same as the source icon.
If the source icon is non 32 bits-per-pixel, the function fails.

target.mrk: If the source icon has no alpha chanel, the resulting icon will be the same as the source icon.
If the source icon is non 32 bits-per-pixel, the function fails.

trans-unit.source: When you are finished using the icon, destroy it using the _WinAPI_DestroyIcon() function.

seg-source.mrk: When you are finished using the icon, destroy it using the _WinAPI_DestroyIcon() function.

target.mrk: When you are finished using the icon, destroy it using the _WinAPI_DestroyIcon() function.
